page.title: 02Swanton Morley. 2
page.content:
Two housing estates have been built within the block, specifically to accommodate R.A.F. families, besides those houses built within the boundaries of the base itself. The number of R.A.F. personell serving on the base has been reduced considerably over the last ten years. As a result, the two R.A.F. quarters within the village have been sold to private ownership. Some of these houses have been sold to Forces families, others have been occupied by people working in the surrounding area. The village has, therefore, tended to become a dormitory village for the nearby towns of Dereham (4miles) and Norwich (15 miles).
There is no single, major source of employment within the area, after that of the R.A.F. camp.
